alert.note: Alert for Plymouth; Woodbury (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Sioux Falls (Southeastern SD, Southwestern MN, and Northwestern IA)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued December 15 at 3:23PM CST until December 15 at 4:30PM CST by NWS Sioux Falls
info.description: The National Weather Service in Sioux Falls has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Western Woodbury County in west central Iowa... Southwestern Plymouth County in northwestern Iowa... Dakota County in northeastern Nebraska... Dixon County in northeastern Nebraska... Southern Union County in southeastern South Dakota... * Until 430 PM CST. * At 322 PM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Hadar to 6 miles south of Pilger to 6 miles south of Dodge, moving northeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Severe thunderstorms will be near... Emerson, Concord and Dixon In Dixon County around 350 PM CST. Allen around 355 PM CST. Homer, Hubbard and Martinsburg around 400 PM CST. Ponca, Dakota City, Salix and Newcastle around 405 PM CST. Sioux City, South Sioux City, Sergeant Bluff and Ponca State Park around 410 PM CST. Elk Point, Sloan, Lawton, Jefferson and Hornick around 415 PM CST. Moville around 420 PM CST. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include Bronson and Waterbury. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CST for northwestern and west central Iowa...northeastern Nebraska...and southeastern South Dakota. This is a DANGEROUS SITUATION. These storms are producing widespread wind damage across parts of Nebraska. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows! A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CST for northwestern and west central Iowa...northeastern Nebraska...and southeastern South Dakota.
